name: Cheesy Quinoa Pilaf with Spinach
author: alliecat3
summary: This creamy pilaf incorporates the fluffy, nutty-flavored grain, quinoa, with a decadent and delicious goat cheese gouda. This has an amazing flavor and texture. Try serving with steamed salmon. I think this would work well with pine nuts as well as a variety of other cheeses.  Try regular goat, Parmesan, blue, etc.
ingredients: ⅓ cup grated goat gouda cheese
directions: Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat
Add the quinoa, and cook until the quinoa is tender, 15 to 20 minutes
Drain in a mesh strainer, and rinse until cold; set aside
Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, stir in the sunflower seeds, and cook until lightly toasted, about 2 minutes
Stir in the garlic, and cook until the garlic softens and the aroma mellows, about 2 minutes
Stir in the cooled quinoa and spinach; cook and stir until the quinoa is hot, and the spinach has wilted
Stir in the lemon juice, and all but a pinch of the cheese
Stir until the cheese has melted
Serve sprinkled with the remaining cheese
